docs.summary: Get the availability of a calendar's sessions, slots, and schedules.

permissions.name: Read Bookings Calendar Availability
permissions.description: Request permission to read the site's bookings calendar availability.

params.name: timezone
params.doc:
The timezone for which session availability is to be calculated. If specified, 
 dates are based on the local date/time, meaning that the timezone offset 
 in the date's format is ignored.

 Learn more about how [timezones and daylight 
 savings](#handling-daylight-savings-time-for-local-time-zones) are handled when
 calculating availability.

params.name: slotsPerDay
params.doc:
Maximum number of slots to load for each date. For example, if `slots_per_day` is set to `3`,
 at most 3 available slots are returned for each day in the date range specified in the query's
 `filter`. 

 When a day has both bookable and non-bookable slots, bookable slots are returned first.
 Non-bookable slots are returned according to the specified filters, after all 
 bookable slots are already included.

docs.summary:
Retrieves the availability for sessions 
 that match the provided query criteria (paging, filtering, and sorting). 


 The Calendar Availability APIs calculate the availability of sessions for 
 appointments and classes, but not 
 for courses.  
 
 The entire list of slots is returned in case you want to display both
 available and non-available slots in the calendar for your customers. 
 Using the `bookable` property, you can limit the display to available
 slots only.
 
 When querying, you must enter a start date and an end date. This avoids very large
 results that can impact performance. 
 
 #### Calculating availability

 The availability is determined 
 by checking: 
 + **The sessions' open slots**. A slot is considered open if the session's 
   capacity is greater than number of participants.
 + **Booking policies**. Policies that affect whether a slot is considered 
   available include `tooEarlyToBook`, `tooLateToBook`, and `bookOnlineDisabled`.

 Locked sessions do not impact session availability and `bookable` can 
 be `true` even if `locked` is `true`. For example, if a session has a waitlist and a 
 place frees up, the slot is offered to the customers on the waitlist, one by one. The
 sesssion remains locked because there is still a waitlist, but for a period of time
 there is availability, until a customer on the waitlist takes the slot. Locking 
 prevents customers who are not yet on the waitlist from grabbing the slot.

 #### Handling Daylight Savings Time for local time zones

 Because of Daylight Savings Time (DST), there are cases where certain times either do not exist 
 or exist twice for a local time zone. 
 For example, the tine `00:05` on September 5th 2021 might not exist in Santiago, Chile, 
 because at `00:00` the clock moved
 1 hour forward to `01:00.

 In this case, the Availability APIs take this 
 into account and mediate the time gaps automatically. The non-existant local time is 
 automtically moved forward 1 hour to match local DST. Local times that exist do not change.
 So if the `Query Availability` endpoint is called with a `startDate` of `2021-09-05T00:00:01.000` 
 and an `endDate` of `2021-09-06T00:00:02.000`, `2021-09-05T01:00:01.000` is used in the query 
 instead. The start time shifts one hour forward and the end time remains the same.

examples.title: Query for available slots for a specific service in a given time range
Query for a service's available slots by resource ID for a given time range
Query for available slots for a service by location and date range
Query for available open slots for a specific service in a given time range
Query for available, bookable slots for a service in a given time range

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.

members.name: filter
members.doc:
Filter object. For a list of 
 fields you can filter by, see [Calendar Availability: Supported Fields, Filters, and Sorting](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/bookings/bookingsavailabilitycalendar/supported-fields,-filters,-and-sorting).
 You must include the `startDate` and `endDate` fields in the filter. This avoids large results that can impact performance.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Sort options.
 Currently, only sorting by `startDate` is supported. For details
 on sorting, see [Calendar Availability: Supported Fields, Filters and Sorting](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/bookings/bookingsavailabilitycalendar/supported-fields,-filters,-and-sorting).

members.name: fields
members.doc: List of projected fields to return. All fields are supported.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: query
members.doc: Query options.

members.name: timezone
members.doc:
The timezone for which session availability is to be calculated. If specified, 
 dates are based on the local date/time, meaning that the timezone offset 
 in the date's format is ignored.

 Learn more about how [timezones and daylight 
 savings](#handling-daylight-savings-time-for-local-time-zones) are handled when
 calculating availability.

members.name: slotsPerDay
members.doc:
Maximum number of slots to load for each date. For example, if `slots_per_day` is set to `3`,
 at most 3 available slots are returned for each day in the date range specified in the query's
 `filter`. 

 When a day has both bookable and non-bookable slots, bookable slots are returned first.
 Non-bookable slots are returned according to the specified filters, after all 
 bookable slots are already included.

members.name: availabilityEntries
members.doc: List of slots that potentially can be booked.

members.name: pagingMetadata
members.doc: Details on the paged set of returned results.

members.name: slot
members.doc: The slot for which the availability is checked.

members.name: timezone
members.doc:
The timezone for which slot availability is to be calculated. If specified, 
 dates are based on the local date/time, meaning that the timezone offset 
 in the date's format is ignored.

 Learn more about how [timezones and daylight savings](#handling-daylight-savings-time-for-local-time-zones) are handled when
 calculating availability.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: The schedule ID for which availability is being checked.

members.name: slot
members.doc:
The slot for the corresponding session, when the session is either a single session 
 or a specific session generated from a recurring session.

members.name: bookable
members.doc:
Whether the slot is bookable. Bookability is determined by checking a 
 session's open slots and booking policies. Locks are not taken into
 account.

members.name: totalSpots
members.doc:
Total number of spots for this slot.
 For example, if a session has a total of 10 spots and 3 spots are booked, 
 `spotsTotal` is 10 and `openSpots` is 7.

members.name: openSpots
members.doc: Number of open spots for this slot.

members.name: waitingList
members.doc: An object describing the slot's waitlist and its occupancy.

members.name: bookingPolicyViolations
members.doc: Booking policy violations for the slot.

members.name: locked
members.doc:
Indicates whether the slot is locked because a waitlist exists. 
When a slot frees up, the slot is offered to the next customer on the waitlist. Read-only.

members.name: sessionId
members.doc:
ID for the slot's corresponding session, when the session is either a single session 
 or a specific session generated from a recurring session.

members.name: serviceId
members.doc: Service ID.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: Schedule ID.

members.name: startDate
members.doc:
The start time of this slot in [RFC 3339](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3339)
 format.

 If `timezone` is specified,
 dates are based on the local date/time. This means that the timezone offset
 in the `start_date` is ignored.

members.name: endDate
members.doc:
The end time of this slot in
 [RFC 3339](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3339) format.

 If `timezone` is specified,
 dates are based on the local date/time. This means that the timezone offset
 in the `end_date` is ignored.

members.name: timezone
members.doc:
The timezone for which slot availability is to be calculated.

 Learn more about how [timezones and daylight savings](#handling-daylight-savings-time-for-local-time-zones) are handled when
 calculating availability.

members.name: resource
members.doc:
The resource required for this slot. Currently, the only supported resource
 is the relevant staff member for the slot.

members.name: location
members.doc: Geographic location of the slot.

members.name: id
members.doc: Resource ID.

members.name: name
members.doc: Resource name. Read only.

members.name: id
members.doc:
Business location ID. Available only for locations that are business locations, 
 meaning the `location_type` is `"OWNER_BUSINESS"`.

members.name: name
members.doc: Location name.

members.name: formattedAddress
members.doc: The full address of this location.

members.name: locationType
members.doc:
Location type.
 
 - `"OWNER_BUSINESS"`: The business address, as set in the siteâ€™s general settings.
 - `"OWNER_CUSTOM"`: The address as set when creating the service.
 - `"CUSTOM"`: The address as set for the individual session.

members.name: totalSpots
members.doc:
Total number of spots and open spots for this waiting list.
 For example, a Yoga class with 10 waiting list spots and 3 registered 
 on the waiting list has 10 `total_spots` and 7 `open_spots`.

members.name: openSpots
members.doc: Number of open spots for this waiting list.

members.name: tooEarlyToBook
members.doc: Bookings policy violation. Too early to book this slot.

members.name: tooLateToBook
members.doc: Bookings policy violation. Too late to book this slot.

members.name: bookOnlineDisabled
members.doc: Bookings policy violation. Online booking is disabled for this slot.

members.name: totalSpots
members.doc:
The total number of spots defined for the schedule, including 
 both open and non-available spots.

members.name: openSpots
members.doc: The number of open spots defined for the schedule.

members.name: bookingPolicyViolations
members.doc: Booking policy violations for the schedule.

members.name: maxParticipantsPerBooking
members.doc:
The policy defining the maximum number of participants that can 
 be booked for a slot or a schedule.

docs.summary:
Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • OWNER_BUSINESS
  • OWNER_CUSTOM
  • CUSTOM
